Metadata: Analysis of the post-â€‹translational processing of alpha-MSH in the pituitaries of the chondrostean fishes, "Acipenser transmontanus" and "Polyodon spathula"

In an effort to sort out the origins of alpha-MSH acetylation mechanisms, this study of the intermediate pituitaries of the chondrostean fishes, "Acipenser transmontanus" (the white sturgeon) and "Polyodon spathula" (the paddlefish) was made. The presence of N-acetylated forms of alpha-MSH in the pituitaries of representatives of the two extant genera of chondrostean fish coupled with the observation that N-acetylated forms of alpha-MSH are present in the pituitaries of cladistian and neopterygian fishes indicates that the alpha-MSH specific N-acetylation mechanism evolved prior to the radiation of the Actinopterygii.
